thread.title: 18 sweet Valentine's Day gifts you can get for under $50
thread.title_full: 18 sweet Valentine's Day gifts you can get for under $50 - Business Insider

author: Ellen Hoffman
title: 18 sweet Valentine's Day gifts you can get for under $50
text:
The Insider Picks team writes about stuff we think you'll like. Business Insider has affiliate partnerships, so we get a share of the revenue from your purchase.
BloomThat
In a dream world, we'd spare no expense to shower our nearest and dearest with gifts come Valentine's Day. But, this is real life, and it is expensive. Which means you may not have tons of cash to burn for February 14 — you might still be paying off bills for those presents you purchased in December.
So, if long-stemmed roses and five-course meals aren't in your cards, or you simply prefer to keep holiday celebrations low-key, I put together a list of gifts under $50 that'll leave all of your loved ones wowed.
Decadent truffles, soothing sheet masks, and luxurious bath oils are just a few examples. See if anything catches you eye.
Having trouble figuring out what to get your loved ones for Valentine's Day? You can also check out Insider Picks' gift ideas for men and women here.
View As: One Page Slides A drip coffee maker Amazon If your Valentine is a big coffee drinker, this drip coffee maker won't go unappreciated.
Osaka Pour-Over Coffee Dripper with Wood Stand, $39.99
A luxurious bath oil Nordstrom If a spa day is too extravagant for your budget, a relaxing bubble bath is something both of you can enjoy at home. Jo Malone's scents all smell amazing, so I can't recommend this gift enough.
Jo Malone Red Roses Bath Oil, $25
An air plant for their nightstand BloomThat A low-maintenance air plant for their desk or nightstand is a little different than the traditional bouquet of flowers, but still fresh and earthy. It'll last a lot longer, too.
BloomThat The Walter Air Plant, $45
A card that tells them how you feel Etsy Don't forget to tell your Valentine you love them! That's really the best gift of all.
You can find Hartland Brooklyn's cards on Etsy. The company's Valentine's Day-themed ones are some of my favorites.
Hartland Brooklyn “Slice of Heaven” Card, $4.50
A personal assistant Amazon Any tech lover will find a lot to like with Amazon's Echo Dot. It can forecast the weather, read an audiobook, order a pizza, tell dad jokes, or any number of things they should find useful.
The Echo Dot is the best value of the Echo family, but if they needs a louder speaker, the original Echo works exactly the same.
Amazon Echo Dot, $49.99
An adult coloring book Amazon It might be time for them to jump on the adult-coloring-book bandwagon. Just make sure you get them some colored pencils .
"Lost Ocean: An Inky Adventure and Coloring Book for Adults" by Johanna Basford, $10.99
A box of chocolates Godiva You can't go wrong with a classic box of Godiva chocolates.
Godiva Signature Truffles Gift Box (12 pieces), $32
A bottle of their favorite red Winc Have a romantic night in on February 14, complete with Cabernet and sopressata.
Winc Creminelli x Chop Shop Gift Box, $50
A good book Amazon If your Valentine is an avid reader , get them a Book of the Month membership .
Each month’s book selections are chosen by recurring and celebrity guest judges who are passionate about books, like Ellie Kemper from "Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt" and Josh Radnor from "How I Met Your Mother." The judges curate and select the best new hardcover titles for members from a broad range of genres and offer a mix of both fiction and nonfiction titles, sure to impress even the pickiest and hard to shop for people.
Book of the Month 3-Month Subscription, $44.97
"The Girl with the Lower Back Tattoo" by Amy Schumer, $14
Matching underwear MeUndies MeUndies' underwear is so comfortable it will blow his mind . Right now, the company is running a promotion where you can get matching underwear for you and your Valentine.
MeUndies Matching Pairs, $42
A ring she can wear every day Mejuri Get her a ring or a pair of earrings she can wear every day. Mejuri's jewelry is a new favorite of mine , and I'm guessing a lot of other women will love the company's delicate collection of rings, necklaces, earrings, and bracelets. You can check out all of Mejuri's jewelry here.
Mejuri Olive Ring Silver, $48
A sheet mask Sephora For healthy, hydrated skin, it's important to moisturize all year long , but this step is especially important in the fall and winter — so this gift has a practical element to it.
Dr. Jart+ Brightening Infusion Hydrogel Mask, $7.50
Something personalized Framebridge Get a favorite picture of the two of you — or your kids or pets — custom framed without spending a small fortune.
Framebridge Heartstagram Framing, $39
One of their favorite albums on vinyl Amazon Listening to vinyl records is popular again. If your Valentine would like to ride the wave, they're going to need a turntable ( U-Turn has a good budget option ) and some records. Why not help them fill out their collection?
I really want this record, so I'm hoping someone I know sees this article and buys it for me.
"Dopamine" by BØRNS Vinyl Record, $19.99
Hoop earrings Catbird A girl can never have too many pairs of earrings. These are also on my Valentine's Day wish list.
Catbird Big Hoop Dream Earrings, $48
A small leather wallet Coach Wallets are items men and women alike often neglect to replace. This wallet from Coach has an ID window on the reverse and a secure zippered compartment for storing her cards and cash.
Coach Mini ID Skinny, $45
A tea mug Teabox If your one and only prefers tea to coffee, this special tea mug paired with a selection of floral teas can offer them some much needed moments of tranquility at work or home.
Teabox Clear Tea Mug, $20.99
Tea Box Aurora Floral Tea Set, $13
An engraved shaving kit Harry's There are certain things he could stand to devote more time to, and taking care of his skin is probably one of them. This isn't to say he needs to start spending half an hour shaving his stubble every morning, but he should at least know how to shave it the right way and with the right tools. Harry's shaving set is a good place to begin; you can even engrave this one with his initials for a personal touch.
Harry’s Engraved Winston Shaving Set, $40
Disclosure: This post is brought to you by Business Insider's Insider Picks team. We aim to highlight products and services you might find interesting, and if you buy them, we get a small share of the revenue from the sale from our commerce partners, including Amazon. Jeff Bezos, CEO of Amazon, is an investor in Business Insider through his personal investment company Bezos Expeditions. We frequently receive products free of charge from manufacturers to test. This does not drive our decision as to whether or not a product is featured or recommended. We operate independently from our advertising sales team. We welcome your feedback. Have something you think we should know about? Email us at insiderpicks@businessinsider.com.
